section name: Connecting Primary Source to its Historical Developments
tier 1 description: Exceptionally specific, clear, and relevant connections are made between the primary sources and historical developments.
tier 2 description: Numerous specific, clear, and relevant connections are made between the selected primary sources and historical developments.
tier 3 description: Some specific, clear, and relevant connections are made between the selected primary sources and historical developments.
tier 4 description: Vague, unclear, and/or irrelevant connections are made between the selected primary sources and historical developments.
tier 5 description: No connections are made between the selected primary sources and historical developments.

section name: Using Supporting Evidence from the Primary Source
tier 1 description: Many specific, clear, and relevant examples from the primary sources are provided as supporting evidence.
tier 2 description: Multiple examples from the primary sources are provided as supporting evidence and most of the evidence is specific, clear, and relevant.
tier 3 description: Multiple examples from the primary sources are provided as supporting evidence and some of the evidence provided is specific, clear, and relevant.
tier 4 description: One (1) example from the primary sources is provided as supporting evidence and/or the evidence provided is vague, unclear, and/or irrelevant.
tier 5 description: No examples are provided from the primary sources as supporting evidence.

tier 1 description: The essay includes many exceptionally specific, clear, and relevant reflections on the global context of this course.
tier 2 description: The essay includes numerous specific, clear, and relevant reflections on the global context of this course.
tier 3 description: The essay includes some specific, clear, and relevant reflections on the global context of this course.
tier 4 description: The essay includes vague, unclear, and/or irrelevant reflections on the global context of this course.
tier 5 description: The essay does not reflect on the global context of this course.

tier 1 description: Writing is clear, concise, and well organized. Thoughts are expressed in a highly coherent and logical manner. There are virtually no spelling, grammar, or syntax errors.
tier 2 description: Communication is mostly clear, concise, and well organized. Ideas and information are expressed in a coherent and logical manner.
tier 3 description: Communication is somewhat clear and organized. There are numerous spelling, grammar, or syntax errors.
tier 4 description: Writing is mostly unclear and/or disorganized. There are numerous spelling, grammar, or syntax errors.
